review_title: Hurley Medical Center was a wonderful place to work.
pros: Excellent working environment.  Quick pay increases.  Awesome experiences.
cons: Hurley is in a not-so-good neighborhood.  Within Hurley's employee handbook it states that no employee shall have on his/her person, or in his/her vehicle anything that could be described as a "weapon".  So, for those of us that are CPL holders, you cannot protect yourself while driving into the heart of the most violent city in the nation, or you risk being fired.

review_title: Not the land of bread and honey
pros: Some very nice people scattered here and there.
cons: I was harassed by coworkers regarding my ethnicity, race, and culture. It was made clear through specific language stating as much that reverse discrimination is the way it's done at Hurley. Supervisors, Administration, and Union Officials did nothing to help me - told me workplace bullying is nothing more than "hazing".

review_title: My temporary job Hurley was a great one,because of my customer service skills it was a highlight.
job_title: Call Center Operator in Chicago, IL
pros: My reason is loving to help people, be able to make a difference within someone. I am a team player and a fast learner. My liking within my job at Hurley I believe that it was a honor.
cons: My reason isnt one,but at first dealing with sick people I had to learn to deal with, times of not being in the office. Prehabs passing in halls and other areas.

review_title: Great Co-workers and pay is decent
pros: Wonderful co-workers, always willing to help and have your back. CNA's on 9E were the best! Great potlucks, especially when working 3rd shift. Felt like a family.. Nothing bad to say about my time on that floor. Pay was decent. Hospital gives a 8% deferential for third shift week nights and 16% deferential on weekends. Excellent insurance.
cons: Pay is decent for working in the hospital. Schedule is sometimes "picket fenced", even after you request multiple times to work block scheduling. Very difficult to obtain a first shift position due to seniority preference given first.

review_title: Best hospital to work at in area!
job_title: Marketing and Social Media Manager in Flint, MI
pros: The Hurley-Family atmosphere.  It's genuine.  People care about one another. Encouraged to grow within the organization - and that is awesome.
cons: Having to defend the reputation of the hospital being in the ghetto, or being a hospital for the poor.  Reality is, this hospital is the BEST for all your loved ones.

review_title: Very busy, at times trying but overall satisfying
pros: It is the best medical facility in our area, our physician's, nurses as well as other staff are very caring.
cons: way too busy in our department for the amount of staff, we tend to over work the wonderful nurses we employ and eventually they find less stressful positions else where.

review_title: Not a good place to work
pros: The pay is good and fits with the market.  The benefits are good and also fit with the market.  That's about it.
cons: 'tManagement doesn't walk their talk.  The unions are out of control and run the place.  The Board is inept and doesn't know anything about healthcare or even how to run a business.  There is racism.  The policies are rigid and there is no trust in employees.

pros: Working with a lot of amazing people.  Having the opportunity to get to know the physicians and nurses on an individual level and knowing that they love what they do.
cons: If you are not in a click of the who's who, you can basically forget about it.  It doesn't matter what degree you have, it's about who you know.  You can't move up. Very disheartening.

pros: Cultural diversity, union & management conflict resolution, negotiated salaries, excellent benefit package ( insurances, paid time-off, paid holidays), teaching environment.  Foster Six Sigma principles and teaching.
cons: Changes to 'operations' seems to take longer than expected.  At times, meetings don't seem as productive as should be.

pros: This is  a teaching hospital.  Staff willing and able to teach.  work together.
